intro: Hibbertia glabrisepala, commonly known as the smooth-winged sandverbena, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Dilleniaceae and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers with narrow, wing-like petals. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils in coastal regions, thriving in well-drained environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and hairy, while the stems are often sprawling or ascending. Hibbertia glabrisepala is often found in heathlands and open forests, where it contributes to the local biodiversity.
